solution.text:
Discount percentage on item = 10 %
Discount = \(\frac{discount\, percentage \times cost\, price}{100} = \frac{10 \times _{{10*j}}_}{100} \) = Rs. _{j}_
Selling price = Cost price - discount = _{{10*j}}_ - _{j}_ = Rs. _{{9*j}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, the selling price = Rs. _{{9*j}}_

content.text: The discount on an item is 10%. If the item costs Rs. _{{ 10*j}}_. What is the selling price of the item?
